name: #Templar Control
desc: The Templars exert all-pervasive control over every aspect of the markets they hold. Increases stability and removes stability penalty from smuggling. Creates some demand for marines to enforce order.

name: Rebellion
desc:
A rebellion is ongoing on $market.

- Stability reduced by $stabilityPenalty
- Increased price of marines, heavy armaments and supplies; black market sales will strengthen rebels, direct sales to base officials will strengthen government

name: Raiding
desc: Hostile raiding fleets are active in the system, disrupting commerce and other activities.

name: Reinforced Defenses
desc: The ground defenses of $market have been reinforced with personnel and heavy armaments, likely in anticipation of a hostile incursion.

name: Tribute
desc:
$market is paying the locally dominant faction a regular tribute for the right to continue existing. Foreign authorities are keeping tight restrictions on local population growth, to keep the colony at a "manageable" size.

Tribute may be canceled if the player chooses to terminate the agreement, or changing circumstances make it no longer applicable.

name: Pirate Activity
desc:
There have been signs that pirates are targeting shipping and colonies in this system - from port inspectors being pressured to turn a blind eye, to inconsistencies in cargo manifests, to other increased criminal activity.

The pirates most likely have a base somewhere relatively nearby.

name: Comm Relay (hidden)
desc: Hidden condition, does not need icon.
